definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: Stage-16 Stator Vane was damaged by foreign objects on several places.
sentences.chinese: 压气机第16级有多处静叶受异物打击受损。

sentences.english: Soviet Reactors can be overcharged, but will cause it to take damage.
sentences.chinese: 苏联的反应堆可过量充电，但会受损。

sentences.english: However, a series of food safety incidents has damaged the country's reputation for fine cuisine.
sentences.chinese: 然而，一系列食品安全事件却令中华美食名声受损。

sentences.english: Well, the X-ray shows your bone hasn's been injured.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，x光射线显示你的骨头未受损伤。

sentences.english: The looting appeared to be dissipating as police vans were stationed at damage sites.
sentences.chinese: 抢劫行动看起来被驻扎在受损地点的警车驱散。

sentences.english: Consumers will have to pay more. The motor and garage trades will be harmed.
sentences.chinese: 消费者会增加开支，汽车和车库生意也会受损。

sentences.english: Harm is a kind of unprofitable state of which right and law have been impaired.
sentences.chinese: 损害是权利和法益受损的一种不利益状态。

sentences.english: Intact skin can protect the body from be invaded by germs.
sentences.chinese: 未受损的肌肤没去外国疑问保护肉体不受细菌侵害。

sentences.english: A daily conditioning shampoo to help protect hair, leaving it soft and manageable.
sentences.chinese: 能有效改善受损发质，令秀发回复柔顺。

sentences.english: Actually, Paris is the most miserable with reputation damaged.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，最惨的仍是巴黎，刹时名望受损。

sentences.english: If a particular cargo is partially damaged, the damage is titled particular average.
sentences.chinese: 假如某批货是部份受损，咱们称之为“单独海损”。

sentences.english: It can damage the teeth, give you headaches and make your jaw hurt.
sentences.chinese: 这会损伤牙齿，让人头疼并使颌骨受损。

sentences.english: The motor and garage trades will be harmed.
sentences.chinese: 机动车买卖和车辆修理业也将受损。

sentences.english: He was jealous for his friend's reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他深怕他朋友的名誉受损害。

sentences.english: The green-tinged part of a chicken breast fillet is the result of a damaged blood vessel.
sentences.chinese: 鸡胸肉中出现的局部绿色缘自鸡肉中血管的受损。

sentences.english: Can you give us some tips on treating damaged hair?
sentences.chinese: 对于处理受损的头发你能不能给我们些建议？

definition: to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
to restore/to renovate/restoration/(computing) to fix (a bug)
to rupture/to fracture/to break down/(linguistics) plosion
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
